item.title: 吉宾斯的对冲基金飙升 54% 后，他将再次动用外部现金
item.description: 对冲基金经理罗伯特-吉宾斯（Robert Gibbins）曾在多年亏损后于 2022 年归还了客户的资金，在他的宏观对冲基金通过改革策略取得两位数收益后，他正寻求再次筹集外部资金。【原文：Hedge fund manager Robert Gibbins, who returned clients’ capital in 2022 following years of losses, is looking to raise external money again after his revamped strategy produced double-digit gains for his macro hedge fund.】

item.title: 高盛赢得股东关于 8000 万美元高管奖金的投票
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc. ）的高管薪酬提案赢得了大多数股东的支持，尽管有批评称其奖金过高，这缓解了人们对该公司在与收购公司竞争时为留住顶尖人才所做努力的担忧。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s executive pay proposal won majority support from shareholders despite criticism the bonuses were excessive, easing concerns over the firm’s push to retain top talent as it competes with buyout firms.】

item.title: 美国新房销售量因南部地区激增而超出预期
item.description: 上个月，美国新房销售量猛增，原因是房贷利率出现了可喜的下降，而且销售激励措施持续不断，从而拉开了春季销售旺季的序幕。【原文：Sales of new homes in the US jumped last month on a welcome dip in mortgage rates and ongoing sales incentives to kick off the crucial spring selling season.】

item.title: 贝森特称美国支持国际货币基金组织和世界银行，同时呼吁改革
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）说，国际货币基金组织和世界银行发挥着 "关键作用"，特朗普政府愿意与它们合作，但同时也表示，它们一直没有完成自己的核心使命。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said that the International Monetary Fund and World Bank serve “critical roles,” and that the Trump administration is willing to work with them, while saying that they have been falling short of their core missions.】

item.title: 康托尔将在 Tether 和软银的支持下成立加密货币公司
item.description: Cantor Fitzgerald 正在与 Tether Holdings SA 和软银集团联手创建一家名为 Twenty One Capital Inc.【原文：Cantor Fitzgerald is teaming up with Tether Holdings SA and SoftBank Group to create a new company called Twenty One Capital Inc., with the goal of accumulating Bitcoin.】

item.title: 受关税影响，美国商业活动增长为 2023 年以来最弱
item.description: 美国商业活动以 2023 年以来最慢的速度扩张，同时产出预期恶化，价格压力增大，关税问题令企业头疼。【原文：US business activity expanded at the slowest pace since 2023, while output expectations deteriorated and price pressures mounted as tariffs created headaches for companies.】

item.title: 考虑下调中国关税，S&P 500 指数大涨近 3
item.description: 据报道，白宫考虑削减对中国的关税，而且唐纳德-特朗普总统表示不打算解雇美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔，美国股市继续反弹。【原文：US stocks continued to rally as the White House reportedly considers slashing tariffs on China and President Donald Trump said he doesn’t plan to fire Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell.】

item.title: 法国以和解姿态化解特朗普贸易紧张局势
item.description: 法国财政部长表示，他同意美国政府对全球商业的分析，并呼吁建立 "双赢 "的跨大西洋伙伴关系。【原文：France softened its approach to the trade clash with Donald Trump as the country’s finance chief said he agreed with the US administration’s analysis of global commerce and called for a “win-win” transatlantic partnership.】

item.title: 匈牙利化肥大亨深陷债权人纠纷
item.description: 匈牙利化肥生产商 Nitrogenmuvek Zrt 的所有者 Laszlo Bige 在与债权人就延长其债券即将到期日的问题僵持不下时，排除了使用有形资产作为抵押的可能性。【原文：Laszlo Bige, the owner of Hungarian fertilizer maker Nitrogenmuvek Zrt, ruled out using tangible assets as collateral in a standoff with creditors over extending a looming maturity date for its bonds.】

item.title: 马斯洛夫斯卡预计，如果CPI疲软，波兰将于5月降息四分之一个百分点
item.description: 波兰货币政策委员会政策制定者加布里埃拉-马斯洛夫斯卡（Gabriela Maslowska）表示，如果 4 月份的通胀数据持续疲软，该委员会可能会在下个月将基准利率下调 25 个基点。【原文：Poland’s Monetary Policy Council may reduce its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points next month if April’s inflation readout stays soft, according to policymaker Gabriela Maslowska.】

item.title: 欧洲垃圾债券市场重开，数周来首次发行债券
item.description: 在经历了数周关税引发的波动之后，欧洲垃圾债券市场重新开市，这是自 4 月初以来的首次发行。【原文：Europe’s junk bond market has reopened with its first offering since early April, following weeks of tariff-induced volatility.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）警告经济增长疲软将导致新一轮全球债务激增
item.description: 国际货币基金组织警告说，由于美国引发的贸易紧张局势导致经济增长放缓和金融市场更加动荡，今年全球公共借贷可能会激增。【原文：The International Monetary Fund warned that global public borrowing will likely surge this year as trade tensions triggered by the US lead to slower economic growth and more volatility on financial markets.】

item.title: 英国央行首席经济学家质疑量化宽松是应对危机的 "大锤
item.description: 英国央行首席经济学家休-皮尔（Huw Pill）对过去危机中量化宽松政策被用作 "大锤 "的方式提出了质疑，一天前，他的一位同事说央行今后应采取更有针对性和更有分寸的方法。【原文：Bank of England Chief Economist Huw Pill has raised doubts over the way quantitative easing was used as a “sledgehammer” during past crises, a day after one of his colleagues said the central bank should take a more targeted and measured approach in future.】

item.title: 美国食品及药物管理局要求提供更多有关其 Covid 疫苗的数据后，Novavax 大幅上涨
item.description: 尽管美国卫生与公众服务部部长小罗伯特-肯尼迪（Robert F. Kennedy Jr.【原文：Novavax Inc. shares rose after US regulators asked for more data on its Covid vaccine, signaling the shot may be on a path to full approval despite US Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. raising doubts about its efficacy.】

item.title: 美国银行在市场动荡中渡过难关得益于它们反对的资本建设
item.description: 在上一轮动荡过去仅仅两年之后，美国的大型银行正处于波涛汹涌的环境中，而这一次，几乎没有人质疑银行业是否有能力渡过即将到来的任何难关。这是因为有充足的资本；具有讽刺意味的是，这是因为银行家们大多反对建立财务缓冲。【原文：Big US banks are navigating a choppy environment just two years after the last round of turmoil, this time with almost no one questioning the industry’s ability to ride out whatever is coming. That’s because there’s plenty of capital — ironically due to a buildup of financial buffers that bankers mostly opposed.】

item.title: 会议记录显示，印度央行认为有理由在关税不确定的情况下放宽政策
item.description: 印度央行周三的货币政策会议纪要显示，印度决策者希望放宽借贷成本，以保护国内需求免受美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的高关税可能引发的经济放缓的影响。【原文：India’s policymakers wanted to ease borrowing costs to shield domestic demand from a possible slowdown triggered by US President Donald Trump’s high tariffs, minutes of the central bank’s monetary policy meeting showed Wednesday.】

item.title: 大功率太阳能电池有望取代电池
item.description:
联想正在使用初创公司 Ambient Photonics 的技术来淘汰键盘中的电池。【原文：

Lenovo is using startup Ambient Photonics’s technology to get rid of batteries in a keyboard.

】

item.title: 特斯拉在经历 2021 年以来最艰难的一个季度后缩减支出计划
item.description: 特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.【原文：Tesla Inc. pared its outlook for capital expenditures this year, cautioning that changes in trade policies may set back its timelines for unspecified projects.】

item.title: 任天堂称日本市场对 Switch 2 控制台需求旺盛
item.description: 任天堂公司（Nintendo Co., Ltd.）表示，其即将推出的游戏机Switch 2在日本市场的需求量非常大，这表明这款小工具有望成为视频游戏行业历史上最大规模的硬件发布。【原文：Nintendo Co. said it is seeing overwhelming demand for its upcoming game console Switch 2 in Japan, in a sign the gadget could be on track for the biggest hardware launch in the video game industry’s history.】

item.title: 纳格尔称，对美国国债避险地位的怀疑对世界不利
item.description: 德国央行行长约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，强劲的美国国债市场对所有人都有好处，即使投资者已经转向德国国债。【原文：Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel said a strong US Treasuries market is good for everyone, even as investors have turned to German bunds.】

item.title: 阿根廷比索走强，米莱伊至今未如预期
item.description: 布宜诺斯艾利斯的交易商们开始对哈维尔-米莱总统提出的阿根廷货币升值至 1 美元兑 1000 比索的目标买账，尽管经济学家们警告说，在美元供应趋于枯竭的下半年，这一趋势可能会逆转。【原文：Traders in Buenos Aires are beginning to buy into President Javier Milei’s target of strengthening Argentina’s currency toward 1,000 pesos per dollar, even as economists warn the trend could reverse in the second half of the year when dollar supply tends to dry up.】

item.title: 通用电气弗诺瓦公司积压燃气轮机以应对电力需求激增
item.description: 通用电气弗诺瓦公司（GE Vernova Inc.【原文：GE Vernova Inc. said it has increased its backlog of orders for gas turbines as global demand for electricity continues to rise.】

item.title: 纳格尔警告：德国面临关税带来的衰退风险
item.description: 德国联邦银行行长约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，由于美国关税的影响，德国今年有可能出现经济衰退。【原文：Germany is in danger of suffering a recession this year due to the fallout from US tariffs, according to Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel.】

item.title: 关税重拳出击，中美燃料贸易再起波澜
item.description:
这个亚洲国家开始从其他地方寻找用于制造丙烷和塑料的液化石油气。【原文：

The Asian nation is starting to look elsewhere for the liquefied petroleum gas that makes propane and plastics. 

】

item.title: 阿波罗斥资 2.2 亿美元押注社区太阳能，以满足蓬勃发展的需求
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司将斥资高达 2.2 亿美元与佛蒙特州的一家社区太阳能公司组建合资企业，以帮助满足美国日益增长的电力需求。【原文：Apollo Global Management Inc. is spending as much as $220 million to form a joint venture with a Vermont-based community solar company to help serve the growing US demand for electricity.】

item.title: 空中客车将从沙特阿拉伯采购钛金属作为喷气机交易的一部分
item.description: 空中客车公司（Airbus SE）计划从沙特阿拉伯采购生产飞机所需的部分金属，这是与沙特国旗航空公司达成的宽体飞机交易的一部分。【原文：Airbus SE plans to source some metal to manufacture its aircraft from Saudi Arabia as part of a widebody aircraft deal with the kingdom’s flag carrier.】

item.title: Alafia AI 将超级计算机放在你的办公桌上
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，奥斯汀-卡尔（Austin Carr）将介绍计算技术的进步，这些技术可以让您更轻松地在办公桌前使用强大的人工智能工具。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Austin Carr looks at computing advances that could make it easier to use powerful artificial intelligences tools right at your desk.】

item.title: 科技巨头将把囤积的 5000 亿美元现金用于更多回购
item.description: 虽然许多投资者都被今年股市大跌中的科技巨头吓跑了，但这些公司很可能会继续投入资金进行回购，这至少会为这些股票提供一个持续的支撑。【原文：While many investors have been scared away from tech giants at the center of this year’s equity rout, the companies are likely to continue plowing money into buybacks that will offer at least one source of continuing support for the stocks.】

item.title: KKR 退出银行对卡罗私人贷款的包销交易
item.description: KKR 为其收购 Karo Healthcare 签订了直接贷款人协议，从而避免了由其选定的银行为初始贷款提供承保。【原文：KKR signed up direct lenders for its acquisition of Karo Healthcare, steering the deal away from the banks it had picked to underwrite the initial loans.】

item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂（Chris Anstey），在华盛顿参加国际货币基金组织/世界银行会议的经济编辑。今天，我们将关注有关贸易谈判时间表的新提示。请将反馈和提示发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您尚未注册接收本新闻通讯，请点击此处。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Washington for the IMF/World Bank meetings.
